Show individual vehicle prices against h.goal: Show individual vehicle prices against horsepower, segmented by origin and faceted by drive_train, to understand how power influences cost across different manufacturing regions and drivetrain types.
Show individual vehicle prices against h.sql:
-- This query selects individual vehicle data to analyze the relationship between price and horsepower.
-- It includes origin and drive_train for segmentation and faceting, and adds contextual fields for richer tooltips and cross-filtering.
SELECT
  make,
  model,
  price,
  horsepower,
  origin,
  drive_train,
  -- Additional detail fields for enhanced interactive exploration
  manufacturer,
  type,
  cylinders,
  CASE
    WHEN man_trans_avail THEN 'Manual Available'
    ELSE 'Manual Not Available'
  END AS manual_transmission_availability,
  passengers
FROM
  $tablename
WHERE
  price IS NOT NULL
  AND horsepower IS NOT NULL

fields.summary: A dataset of individual vehicles, showing the relationship between price and horsepower, segmented by origin and faceted by drivetrain type, with additional contextual details for interactive exploration.

Analyze the median mpg_city for each veh.goal: Analyze the median mpg_city for each vehicle type, faceted by whether a manual transmission is available, to identify fuel efficiency trends across vehicle categories and transmission options.
Analyze the median mpg_city for each veh.sql:
-- Calculate the median city MPG for each vehicle type, faceted by manual transmission availability
SELECT
  "type" AS vehicle_type,
  CASE
    WHEN "man_trans_avail"
    THEN 'Manual Available'
    ELSE 'Manual Not Available'
  END AS manual_transmission,
  MEDIAN("mpg_city") AS median_city_mpg
FROM
  $tablename
WHERE
  "type" IS NOT NULL AND "mpg_city" IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY
  "type",
  "man_trans_avail"
ORDER BY
  vehicle_type,
  manual_transmission;

fields.summary: A summary of median city MPG for each vehicle type, segmented by the availability of manual transmission, to highlight fuel efficiency trends.

fields.name: vehicle_type
fields.label: Vehicle Type
fields.description: Original field [type] used without modification.

fields.name: manual_transmission
fields.label: Transmission
fields.description: Derived from [man_trans_avail]: Transformed boolean values into human-readable labels: 'Manual Available' for true and 'Manual Not Available' for false.

fields.name: median_city_mpg
fields.label: Median City MPG
fields.description: Derived from [mpg_city]: Median of city MPG, calculated for each vehicle type and transmission availability.

Rank manufacturers by their average fuel.goal: Rank manufacturers by their average fuel_tank_capacity, segmented by the type of air_bags offered, to highlight which manufacturers prioritize larger fuel tanks and how this relates to safety features.
Rank manufacturers by their average fuel.sql:
SELECT
    TRIM(manufacturer) AS manufacturer,
    COALESCE(NULLIF(TRIM(air_bags), ''), 'Not Specified') AS air_bags,
    AVG(fuel_tank_capacity) FILTER (WHERE fuel_tank_capacity IS NOT NULL) AS average_fuel_tank_capacity
FROM
    $tablename
WHERE
    manufacturer IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY
    1, 2
ORDER BY
    average_fuel_tank_capacity DESC;

fields.summary: A ranked list of automobile manufacturers by their average fuel tank capacity, segmented by the type of airbags offered. This highlights which brands provide larger fuel tanks and how this capacity varies with the vehicle's safety features.

fields.name: manufacturer
fields.label: Manufacturer
fields.description: Derived from manufacturer: Vehicle manufacturer, used as a grouping dimension. TRIM() has been applied to remove leading/trailing whitespace.

fields.name: air_bags
fields.label: Air Bags
fields.description: Derived from air_bags: Type of airbags, used as a grouping dimension. Cleaned using TRIM() and COALESCE() to handle empty or NULL values, defaulting to 'Not Specified'.

fields.name: average_fuel_tank_capacity
fields.label: Avg Fuel Tank Capacity
fields.description: Derived from fuel_tank_capacity: The average fuel tank capacity, calculated for each manufacturer and airbag type combination. NULL values in the source data were excluded from the average calculation.

Examine the relationship between individ.goal: Examine the relationship between individual vehicle weight and length, segmented by vehicle type and faceted by the number of cylinders, to understand how physical dimensions contribute to mass across different vehicle configurations.
Examine the relationship between individ.sql:
SELECT
  make,
  model,
  weight,
  length,
  type AS vehicle_type,
  cylinders,
  manufacturer,
  origin,
  drive_train,
  CASE
    WHEN man_trans_avail THEN 'Available'
    ELSE 'Not Available'
  END AS manual_transmission_available
FROM $tablename
WHERE
  weight IS NOT NULL AND length IS NOT NULL AND type IS NOT NULL AND cylinders IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY
  make ASC;

fields.summary: A detailed view of individual vehicles, showing the relationship between weight and length, segmented by vehicle type and faceted by the number of cylinders, to analyze how physical dimensions relate to mass across different configurations.
